Name: berlinwall_berlin_union
LayerDisplayName: Berlin Wall Boundary, Cold War Era
Originator: Digital Scholarship Center, University Libraries, George Mason
OriginatorSort: Digital Scholarship Center, University Libraries, George Mason
Abstract: This polygon boundary shows the boundary of wall between East and West Berlin during the cold war period (1945-1990).

    <descript>
      <abstract>This polygon boundary shows the boundary of wall between East and West Berlin during the cold war period (1945-1990).</abstract>
      <purpose>It  was created to support faculty and students at Mason for their research and teaching purpose by Digital Scholarship Center (DiSC) staff, University of Libraries at George Mason University.</purpose>
    </descript>

    <lineage>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>A scanned map of Berlin Wall line between East and West Germany during the cold war period (1945-1990) was georeferenced and digitized to create a wall line as a vector file using ArcMap.  This vector line was converted to a polygon using buffer tool to merge with the existing Berlin boundary shape file.</procdesc>
        <procdate>2021</procdate>
      </procstep>
    </lineage>
  </dataqual>
